title: Paid Notice: Memorials  POWELL, ANN B.
description: POWELL-Ann B. In life you were always joyfully there. You are gone 13 years but you are still here. Everlasting love, Harry

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  EPSTEIN, BETTY
description: EPSTEIN-Betty. Your lifelong kindnesses to the children will be remembered always. The Kreigsteins, Bairds, Schorrs And Your Friends of AKIM

title: White House Tries to Defuse Push for Steel Import Quotas
description: With the Senate poised to act Tuesday on a bill that would sharply restrict the amount of imported steel in the United States, the Clinton Administration took a series of actions today to convince Congress that it could protect the jobs of American steelworkers with far less drastic measures.

title: G.O.P. Attorneys General Unite To Push an Agenda of Restraint
description: At a time of new activism among state attorneys general, Republicans are creating an attorneys general association of their own to promote government restraint and raise money for the election of more Republicans to the post.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  STONE, MIRIAM SCADRON
description: STONE-Miriam Scadron. June 6, 1999. Wife of the late Dr. Melvin Stone, mother of Deborah, Fred and Doug. She was an accomplished musical composer and dedicated wife and mother. Memorial service Thursday, June 10, 3:30 PM, at Frank E. Campbell, 1076 Madison Avenue at 81st Street.

title: Yankees' Batting Order Is Anything but in Order
description: The Yankees' powerful engine roars to life, and they hit and catch the ball and score runs and they are a great team again, briefly. And then the machine with all the shining parts sputters and dies.

title: Physicists Zero In On Ghostly Neutrinos
description: Scientists operating huge underground detectors in Japan and Canada are racing to obtain independent proofs that the elusive neutrino, a ghostly particle whose vast family may constitute a large part of the mass of the universe, changes form as it flies through matter or space.

title: INSIDE
description: Democracy in Question

title: First Smallpox Vaccination
description: To the Editor:

title: Chimps, Yes. But They've Got Culture
description: Researchers observing various groups of chimpanzees in West and Central Africa have recorded differences in the groups' behavior, including fishing for ants with a probe, pounding food with a stone, dancing in the rain and aiming thrown stones (as shown above). Researchers say these variations in behaviour amount to differences in culture, once thought to be strictly human.

title: Dolores Jimenez Alcantara, Spanish Flamenco Singer, 90
description: Dolores Jimenez Alcantara, a blind singer who was one of Spain's leading flamenco artists, died on June 14 in a hospital in Malaga. She was 90.

title: Next Starr Report May Help New York; Balanced Investigation
description: To the Editor:

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  SINGER, HILDTRUDE (TRUDI)
description: SINGER-Hildtrude (Trudi). Died peacefully June 21, 1999 at the age of 83 after a prolonged illness. She was the youngest woman to ever pass the Missouri Bar at the age of 21 in 1937. She received her Bachelor Law from the University of Missouri in 1936, her Masters Law in 1938 and her Doctor Law in 1940. In 1961, she passed the New York State Bar and worked for Classic Medallics from 1962 until her illness. Trudi is loveingly remembered by her husband Bruno, her five sons Brian and Jerry McCampbell, Ronald, Gerald and Peter Singer and her eight grandchildren. Services will be held today, June 22nd 3-5pm, 7-9pm at the McLaughlin Kramer Funeral Home, 220 Glen St, Glen Cove, N.Y. 11542.

title: In Montreal, The Slavery Of the Past And Present
description: Like a museum devoted to displays of pressed flowers, ''Angelique'' is a work that will appeal most to those with a taste for the drier things in life. Despite a gallant performance by the luminous Lisa Gay Hamilton, the 90-minute drama is a muddle of calcifying ideas and literary aspiration.

title: THE MARKETS: COMMODITIES
description: COCOA RISES. Cocoa prices rose on speculation that the Ivory Coast, the world's top grower, would produce a smaller-than-usual crop later this year. In New York, cocoa for July delivery rose $37 a metric ton, to $1,155.

title: Paid Notice: Memorials  ROSENBERG, BARBARA SCHWAB
description: ROSENBERG-Barbara Schwab. Happy Birthday, Bobs. It's almost two years. There will never ever be another you. Love always, Johnnie, Ted, Cathy & Pa

title: Putting Health at Risk Just for the Fun of It
description: My wife and I had barely settled down across from each another when she got the bad news: she had smallpox. An inauspicious start, I thought, trying to tamp down any sense of satisfaction.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  WASSERMAN, LOUIS R., M.D.
description: WASSERMAN-Louis R., M.D. Age 88, Professor Emeritus of Hematology at Mount Sinai Hospital School of Medicine, of Sandy Hook, CT on June 21, 1999. Beloved husband of Julia Wasserman, devoted brother of Natalie W. Wolf. Services will be held at the convenience of the family. A celebration of Life will be held at a later date. Contributions may be made to the Hematology Department, Mt. Sinai School of Medicine, c/o Development Office, Box 1049, 1 Gustave L. Levy Place, NY, NY 10029 or the Danbury Hospital Development Fund, 24 Hospital Avenue, Danbury, CT 06810.

title: Rise in Technology Lifts Nasdaq and S.& P. but Dow Falls
description: Optimism that second-quarter earnings will be strong pushed technology stocks up for the fifth straight session yesterday. But a rise in interest rates hurt cyclical stocks, and the blue-chip Dow Jones industrial average closed lower.

title: Weyerhaeuser Agrees to Buy MacMillan Bloedel for $2.45 Billion
description: Weyerhaeuser Inc. said today that it had agreed to acquire MacMillan Bloedel Ltd., one of the biggest forestry companies in western Canada, in a stock deal valued at $2.45 billion.

title: Metro Business; Infirmary Will Join Continuum Health
description: The New York Eye and Ear Infirmary -- the nation's oldest specialty hospital and the last one in the city to remain independent in a wave of mergers -- announced yesterday that it would become part of Continuum Health Partners, which runs Beth Israel Medical Center and St. Luke's-Roosevelt Hospital Center.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  WELDON, JEFFREY
description: WELDON-Jeffrey. Loving son of Mort and Louise, beloved brother of Karen and brother-in-law of Dimitri. We shall miss him forever. Service June 23 at 2pm at Ferncliff Chapel, Secor Rd., Hartsdale, NY

title: The Choice of Dancing of Seeing Dancing
description: In addition to dancing the night away, patrons of the Limelight can now watch dance companies there. This popular Chelsea club has established a striking new performance space called the Limelight Theater, Avenue of the Americas at 20th Street, Chelsea, and Cortez & Company (Contemporary/Ballet) is the first professional troupe to appear there.

title: The Latest Breast Implant Verdict
description: The most authoritative analysis yet conducted of the safety of silicone breast implants has concluded that they do not cause the kinds of health problems that have spawned a raft of lawsuits and wrung settlements costing some $7 billion from the manufacturers. The finding should bring at least temporary relief from anguish and uncertainty for more than 1.5 million American women who currently carry such implants in their bodies and may have worried that they were in grave jeopardy. But it is not the final word, and it will bring little solace to the companies that have shelled out billions of dollars to women whose illnesses appear, if this analysis is correct, unrelated to the implants.

title: Sports of The Times; The Knicks Come From Nowhere
description: THERE was no hint of this. None. There was nothing in the first two games to suggest that the Knicks could minimize Tim Duncan, and win their last chance to make something of this championship round.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  BERMAN, ALFRED, M.D.
description: BERMAN-Alfred, M.D. FACS. 88 years of age, of Bayside, NY. Beloved husband of Bernice for 53 years. Father of Steven and Wendy Berman of Vermont; Michael and Rachel Berman, and Peter and Jean Berman of New York. He was a devoted family man who took pride in his grandchildren, Megan, Travis and Josh, Ava and Eric, and Jason and Matthew. Dr. Berman was combat surgeon during WW II, and during his career served as Chief of Surgery at Flushing and Booth Memorial Hospitals. His life will be celebrated in remembering how he used his gifts and compassion to ease the suffering of others and save many lives. He will be remembered for his dedication to his golf game, his love of the New York Yankees, and for his great sense of humor.

title: Hong Kong Decides on a Way To Sell Big Portfolio of Shares
description: For sale: $25 billion worth of shares in blue-chip companies of Hong Kong. Seller seeks individual or institutional buyers. Few other details available. Call Hong Kong government.

title: Corrections
description: An article on Friday about a senior at La Guardia High School in Manhattan who used a quotation from Hitler in her yearbook misstated the school's connection to the 1980 movie ''Fame.'' The Fiorello H. La Guardia High School of Music & Art and Performing Arts opened near Lincoln Center in 1984, combining two former schools -- Music and Art and Performing Arts. ''Fame'' was set at the High School of Performing Arts, not at La Guardia.

title: Dangerous Escalation in Kashmir
description: India and Pakistan have long engaged in cycles of confrontation and rapprochement, with war and threats of war followed by pledges of cooperation. Now the latest promises of peace have yielded to the worst fighting in decades. The provocation is the presence of well-armed Islamic militants holding mountainous positions on Indian territory, seeking independence for Kashmir, India's only Muslim-dominated state. India, which has tried bombing and shelling to dislodge them, is rightly demanding that Pakistan help in removing the guerrillas as the first step toward defusing the current crisis.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  GIBSON, GEORGE W.
description: GIBSON-George W. 74, of Surfside Beach, SC, died Sunday in SC. Predeceased by his wife Mary Stroock Gibson; survived by sons, daughters and sisters. Memorials may be made to the American Lung Association of SC, PO Box 488, Florence, SC 29501.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  NASSAU, KAY
description: NASSAU-Kay. Beloved widow of Manuel. Cherished mother of Gary and Stephen. Dear motherin-law of Beverly and Adrienne. Loving grandmother of Michelle, Brad, Margot, David and Robert. Cherished great grandmother of Jacob. Services at Riverside Memorial Chapel, 21 W. Broad St, Mount Vernon N.Y. today, 1:30PM.

title: Drug Maker Pulls Antihistamine From Market
description: Hismanal, an antihistamine that has fallen out of favor with consumers in the wake of warnings about its safety and the emergence of less dangerous alternatives, is being withdrawn from the market, the Food and Drug Administration announced today.

title: When a Quick Fix Becomes A Longer-Term Problem
description: For most parents and many doctors, antibiotics are a quick fix for the colds, fevers and assorted ailments of childhood. As the contributors to ''Epidemic,'' tonight's ''Fred Friendly Seminar,'' caution, the worried parents and busy doctors are co-conspirators in the development of drug-resistant bacteria that threaten health around the globe.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  EBIN, RUTH S.
description: EBIN-Ruth S. June 18, 1999, beloved wife and companion of David. Cherished mother of Jonathan. A woman of wise wit and rare flair, enhancing friends and all who knew her.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  KRISTELLER, PAUL OSKAR
description: KRISTELLER-Paul Oskar. Columbia University Libraries mourn the passing of Paul Oskar Kristeller, Woodbridge Professor Emeritus of Philosophy in the University, scholar, benefactor and friend of libraries and librarians around the world.

title: MetroStars Just Hope This Is Rock Bottom
description: With foreign aid still nowhere in sight, the MetroStars are going from bad to wretched in Major League Soccer. Their 6-0 loss in Kansas City on Sunday was their fifth defeat in a row and the worst in their four-year history.

title: And You Thought Your Boss Was Bad
description: All job interviews should go this well. The applicant, a homeless man who calls himself Brand, admits right off the bat that he has no skills and no experience. All he has to offer, really, is his ability to walk and to read addresses. But the interviewer seems to really want to help, asks him to come back the next day and lends him $10 and a pocket watch. Naturally there's a great big catch.

title: Listen Up: Ordonez Is Hitting Up a Storm
description: In his first three seasons in the major leagues, Rey Ordonez seemed to be the personification of the good-field, no-hit shortstop. He captured two consecutive Gold Gloves but looked pretty helpless with a bat in his hands.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  DUNAWAY, WALTER HUBERT
description: DUNAWAY-Walter Hubert. Retired EVP of Jeffries Avlon, Inc., NY, NY, June 7, 1999 in Lumpkin, Georgia. A Navy Veteran of the Korean War, he was a survivor of the USS Cochino which went down in the North Sea in 1949. Survived by wife Colleen of Lumpkin, GA (formerly of Hastings-on-Hudson, NY); daughter Elizabeth Levin of Berkeley Heights, NJ; brothers John & Royce and sister Carolyn Taylor and two grandchildren. Donations in his memory to the Lumpkin, GA Volunteer Fire Dept.

title: In Test of New U.S. Law, Death Sentence Is Upheld
description: The Supreme Court today narrowly upheld the first death sentence to come before it under the greatly expanded Federal death penalty law.

title: A Pied Piper Lures San Franciscans to the Concert Hall
description: Walking into Davies Hall for the opening-night concert of the San Francisco Symphony's current Stravinsky Festival on June 11, I thought for a moment I had been zapped to a Manhattan movie theater on a weekend night. Among those who filled the 2,700-seat concert hall were the middle-aged and elderly culture buffs who traditionally have been the mainstays of American orchestras. But there were young people everywhere, arrayed in jeans, sports shirts, sneakers and other casual wear, as well as many snazzily dressed young couples (mixed and same-sex) clearly enjoying a special night out. It was enough to make the heart soar with hope for the future of classical music.

title: Not Far From the Rose Garden, Another Museum for Gehry
description: The Corcoran Gallery of Art has selected Frank O. Gehry as the winner of a competition to design a new wing for its historic Beaux-Arts building one block west of the White House. The addition would nearly double the space that houses the museum and the Corcoran School of Art.

title: Mets May Recall Dotel As a Starter
description: There is a 50-50 chance that the Mets will recall the 23-year-old pitching prospect Octavio Dotel from Class AAA Norfolk today to take Jason Isringhausen's place in the starting rotation, a high-ranking official in the Mets' organization said yesterday.

title: Rebel General Planning A New Army for Kosovo
description: The chief of the general staff of the Kosovo Liberation Army already has the formation of a future army for Kosovo planned out, even as he is preparing to disarm and demobilize his guerrilla force.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  GLASS, FELIX, DR.
description: GLASS-Felix, Dr. Beloved husband of Felice (nee Epstein). Loving father of Lonnie & Joel Parker, Dr. Michael and Debbe Glass and Caasi Glass. Cherished grandfather of Dana, Matthew, Hillary, Ryan, Alisha and Stephen. Dear brother of Beatrice Lester and Ruth Fensterheim. Services ''Boulevard-Riverside'', 1450 Broadway, Hewlett, L.I., 12:30PM Thursday.

title: Try Carrots for Moscow
description: To the Editor:

title: METRICOM GETS $600 MILLION TO DEVELOP NETWORK
description: Metricom Inc. said yesterday that MCI Worldcom Inc. and Paul Allen, a co-founder of the Microsoft Corporation, would invest $600 million to speed development of its nationwide network for wireless data and Internet services. Metricom shares rose $4.8175 each, or 43 percent, to $15.875. MCI Worldcom, the No. 2 United States long-distance phone company, and Mr. Allen's Vulcan Ventures Inc. agreed to each invest $300 million in new convertible preferred shares, giving MCI Worldcom a 38 percent stake and raising Vulcan's stake to 49 percent. Metricom shareholders will own the remaining 13 percent.

title: A Dealing With David Duke Haunts Louisiana Governor
description: The tranquillity that descended over Louisiana politics for the last four years had become positively Midwestern, and that is not a compliment in the state that invented Tabasco. It had been years since anyone in office was indicted, marriage vows were staying intact, and leading officials of the two parties respected each other so much that they had actually agreed to a non-aggression pact.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  SACHS, FREDERICK L., M.D.
description: SACHS-Frederick L., M.D. Pulmonary Associates of New Haven wishes to express our deepest regret at the passing of our founder, mentor, teacher, physician and friend, Frederick L. Sachs, M.D. Our condolences are extended to his devoted wife, Ruth, and his dear daughters, Lori, Jennifer and Alison. We will always remember his kindness and humor. With our deepest sympathy, Brett J. Gerstenhaber, M.D. Peter R. Rogol, M.D. Kevin J. Twohig, M.D. Ernest D. Moritz, M.D. Kenneth J. Dobuler, M.D. Herbert Knight, M.D. and The Office Staff

title: An Open Mind
description: Heroic is a word that rarely leaps to the lips when talk turns to golf. But if Payne Stewart's one-shot victory at the U.S. Open on Sunday was not heroic in the physical-bravery sense, it certainly met the competitive definition of grace under pressure. He had won the tournament before, and he had lost before too, after going into the final round last year with a four-stroke lead that vanished by late afternoon. Stewart returned to the Open this year much as Juli Inkster did to the U.S. Women's Open earlier this month -- determined to redeem a painful loss.

title: Directionless? Scientists Offer Some Clues
description: So I'm walking down Lexington Avenue in Manhattan on a gorgeous Saturday afternoon, and I stop to admire a church that I'd never really noticed before: St. Jean Baptiste, on the corner of 76th Street.

title: Prices Suffer Their Largest Decline in More Than a Week
description: Bond prices suffered their biggest drop in more than a week as the Treasury and the Ford Motor Credit Company led borrowers selling at least $18 billion of debt this week.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  SONNENREICH, JOSEPH I.
description: SONNENREICH-Joseph I. Joe's life enriched us all by virtue of his goodness, his integrity, his wisdom, and his pride in family achievements. We shall ''Sing his Praise'' as we honor him, in loving remembrance of his life, at services today Thursday, June 10, at Riverside Chapel, 76 Street and Amsterdam Avenue, at 11:30 AM. The Sonnenreich Family

title: Mets Can Make Headway Against Marlins by Playing Heads Up
description: A fleeting thought on a rainy summer afternoon, the first rainy summer afternoon of the year: Which Mets team will show up this week at Shea Stadium, the contender or the pretender?

title: The Open at Pinehurst: Drama of Tony Quality
description: Instead of facing Phil Mickelson in an 18-hole playoff today, Payne Stewart enjoyed being United States Open champion for the second time.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  GEORGES, VIVIAN
description: GEORGES-Vivian, daughter of Mary and the late Nicholas, sister of Velia and Spero and Daniel and Joyce. Reposing at Torregrossa Funeral Home, 1305 79th St., Brooklyn until Saturday 8:30AM. Funeral liturgy S.S. Constantine and Helen G.O. Church, 9:30AM. Visiting hours Thursday and Friday 2-5PM and 7-9PM.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  FELDBERG, TRUDY
description: FELDBERG-Trudy. On June 20, 1999. Devoted wife of Murray. Beloved mother of Alyse (Myles), Robert, and Ian (Sue). Cherished grandmother of Isaac and Celia. Loving sister of Rose Lassar and Benjamin Lurie. Service Tuesday, 11:30AM, Garlick Kirschenbaum Chapels, 1153 Coney Island Ave. Interment Montefiore Cemetery.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  BAUM, ABRAHAM S.
description: BAUM-Abraham S. 90 years. Of Spring Valley, NY, formerly of Lake Worth, FL. and Scarsdale, NY. Suddenly on June 8, 1999. Husband for 62 years of the late Mae Weiner Baum. Retired CPA and Past District Deputy Grand Master 8th Masonic District of Manhattan. Loving father of Betye and Alan Wasserman, Spring Valley, NY and Stanley and Louise Baum of Atlanta, GA. Adored grandfather of Roberta Ginsberg, Andrew Wasserman, Rachel Baum and Lauren Baum, and great-grandfather. Graveside services today, 11AM, Mt. Hebron Cemetery.

title: Pataki Avoids A Showdown On Payments For Medicaid
description: Gov. George E. Pataki and legislative leaders pulled back today from their threat to make the state's health care industry a casualty of the fight over the state budget.

title: Waiting for the Doctor
description: To the Editor:

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  ALBERTS, PHILLIP
description: ALBERTS-Phillip, on June 8, 1999. Beloved husband of Elaine. Loving father of Michelle and Julie, Steven and Jane, Alan and Nancy, Rebecca and Roger. Brother of Joan Onorato. Grandfather of Michael, Jennifer, Jason, Mellisa and Jonathon. Services ''BoulevardRiverside'', 1450 Broadway, Hewlett, L.I., Thursday 11:30AM.

title: Lobbyists Are a Lode for the Leading Presidential Campaigns
description: Gov. George W. Bush of Texas is running as a Washington outsider, but that is not stopping a galaxy of Washington insiders from contributing more than $1 million to his Presidential campaign at a fund-raiser here on Tuesday night.

title: Accounts
description: * Suretrade, New York, an on-line broker, to the New York office of Wieden & Kennedy, to handle on-line duties for its account, which had been at CKS/Site Specific, part of USWeb/CKS Group. Billings were estimated at $6 million to $9 million. Wieden & Kennedy has had the off-line part of the account since 1997.

title: NATO TO CONSIDER LETTING KOSOVARS SET UP NEW ARMY
description: The agreement reached early today to disband the Kosovo Liberation Army included, at the insistence of its commanders, a pledge by the NATO allies to consider letting the rebels form a provisional army for Kosovo modeled on the National Guard in United States.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  MERNS, ADRIENNE
description: MERNS-Adrienne. The officers and directors of the Children's Blood Foundation extend their heartfelt condolences to our esteemed board member, Sy Syms on the passing of his beloved daughter Adrienne. We wish to extend our sincerest sympathy to Lynn Syms, our fellow board member, their children and family on their loss. John Calicchio, Chairman Margaret Hilgartner, MD, Pres Lawrence Bass, VP, Susan Byrne, Executive Director

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  LEVAVY, ZVI
description: LEVAVY-Zvi. The American Friends of Tel Aviv University mourns the passing of a cherished and devoted friend Zvi Levavy. His committment and dedication, through the generosity of the Morris J. & Betty Kaplun Foundation, established and improved the Kaplun Building of Physics at Tel Aviv University and supported numerous research projects at the University. Our heartfelt condolences to his family. The American Friends of Tel Aviv University Alan L. Aufzien, Chairman, Board of Directors Melvin S. Taub, Chairman Emeritus Robert J. Topchik, President Stephen Lecker, Exec. V.P.

title: AUSTRIAN BRICK MAKER IS ENTERING U.S. MARKET
description: Wienerberger Baustoffindustrie A.G., the world's largest maker of bricks, agreed yesterday to buy General Shale L.L.C. for $260 million to enter the United States building-materials market, the world's largest. General Shale, the United States brick operations of Etex/Marley Group of Belgium, is the second-largest United States brick maker, with 25 plants in eight states and about 12 percent of the market, according to Wienerberger, which is based in Vienna. General Shale, based in Johnson City, Tenn., had sales of $163.7 million in the fiscal year ended March 31.

title: Kurdish Rebel Leader to Speak When Trial Resumes Tomorrow
description: The trial of the Kurdish rebel leader Abdullah Ocalan is scheduled to resume on Wednesday after a 15-day break, and he could be sentenced to death within days.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  SCHENKMAN, SELWYN, DR.
description: SCHENKMAN-Selwyn, Dr. We mourn the passing of the longtime president of our division, a devoted colleague, a caring friend and a gifted and innovative practitioner. Throughout his distinguished career, he was an ardent and eloquent advocate for the advancement of his profession. Our condolences to his family on their loss. Bronx Divsion NY State Podiatric Medical Association

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  KAPLAN, MURIEL
description: KAPLAN-Muriel. Of West Palm Beach, Florida formerly of Sands Point, New York, passed away June 20, 1999. Loving and devoted wife of Leonard H., cherished mother of Carol (Steven) Prakin and Marla (David) Freeman, incredible grandmother of Alison. Services in Florida.

description: Some disaster planners worry about the Y2K problem or hurricanes or earthquakes. In Greenwich, they fear Powerball.
